bibl.title: Salfest A. Sylvester v. Stener S. Wenaas.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.ab: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
div1.p: Comes now the respondent Stener S. Wenas and states that he has the defendant Salfest A. Sylvester in his possession as the duly accredited agent of the State of North Dakota, and further returning to said writ states that he denies that the said petitioner was or is unlawfully or illegally restrained of his liberty. Admits that the said petitioner is in the custody and control of this respondent and that said custody is in all things legal and in accordance with the constitution and laws of the United States, the States of North Dakota and Washington. That this respondent as the agent of the State of North Dakota, holds custody of the said petitioner under and by virtue of a warrant and for the arrest and extradition of said petitioner issued by His Excellency, J. R. Rogers, Governor of the State of Washington, a copy of said warrant being hereto attached and made a part of this return, the original nevertheless being now and here produced in court.

Respondent further represents that the Petitioner applied to the Superior Court of the King County in December, 1898 for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, but upon a hearing he was remanded to your Respondent, from which order of the Superior Court he appealed to the Supreme Court of the State of Washington; that upon the 20th day of June, 1899, the Superme Court of the State of Washington affirmed the judgment of the lower court and directed that the Petitioner be delivered to your Respondent forthwith; that the Remittitur of the Supreme Court has been received and is now on file in the Clerk's Office of King County, the original Remittitur and a certified copy of the Supreme Court opinion is herewith produced in court.
div1.ab: Jas F. McElroy atty for Resp
STATE OF WASHINGTON) (ss County of King.)
div1.p: Stener S. Wenas being first suly sworn, on oath, deposes and says: I am one of the respondents in the above entitled matter; as such I make the foregoing return, and that the facts and statements set forth in the foregoing return are true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 26th day of June, A.D. 1899.
div1.ab: Cowin S Shaun Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
